result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Daniel A Massey was found guilty of OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: -If revoked: sentence credit of 2 days is granted.
-Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes: -Fine to be paid as a condition of probation. Cash bail applied to fine. Fine paid in full.

-Costs to be paid as a condition of probation. Cash bail applied to costs. Costs paid in full. 
-Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
-Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to City of Waukesha Police Department.

-Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed. 
-No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. 
-Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel. 
-Comply with all rules of OWI treatment Court and remain in good standing.

-If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
-First 60 days Huber with Non Working Hours with Standard Release Conditions or on electronic monitoring at the discretion of the OWI Treatment team.
-Balance STAYED; to be used at the agent's discretion. To be served Straight-Time if imposed. 
-Commencing Forthwith.

records.addlTxt:
10:54 AM Defendant Daniel A Massey in court with attorney Daniel R Skarie.  Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Officer James Miller, of the City of Muskego Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Thompson.
Cross examination by attorney Skarie.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State moves for bind over.
The Defense presents closing arguments and objects to bind over.
The State presents counter arguments and still requests bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

DEFENDANT PREVIOUSLY POSTED $500.00; DEFENDANT NEEDS TO POST AN ADDITIONAL $2500.00.

NEW CONDITION ORDERED ON 06/30/2022:  Defendant to remain on Remote Breath until further order of the Court.

PREVIOUSLY ISSUED CONDITIONS:
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.   Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.   The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.

08:59 AM; Case called for Bail/bond hearing.   Defendant Daniel A Massey in court with attorney Daniel R Skarie.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes the matter is before the court to address WCS non-compliance filed on 6/27/22.  Court inquires why the defendant is not on SCRAM.  Atty. Skarie responds and advises it is due to his work.  Court notes the WCS report is incorrect as it lists SCRAM.  Atty. Skarie confirms the defendant is on remote breath, not SCRAM.  Atty. Skarie presents statements with regards to the non-compliance and is asking the court to not take any action with regards to bail at this time.  Atty. Gordon is requesting an additional cash bail and SCRAM monitoring and presents statements with regards to the WCS non-compliance.  Jonathan Reinke, with WCS, appeared by telephone means.  Mr. Reinke sworn in and testifies.  Questionned by the Court.  Mr. Reinke's testimony rests; witness is released.  Atty. Skarie presents additional statements and is asking the court to not impose SCRAM.  Atty. Gordon presents additional statements.  Court places its findings on the record.  Court inquires if the defendant is in any treatment.  Atty. Skarie responds.  For reasons placed on the record the Court will increase cash bail to a total of $3000.00; defendant will need to post an additional $2500.00 cash bail.  Court will also order that the defendant remain on remote breath until further order of the Court.  Court will maintain the previously scheduled Preliminary hearing set for 07/06/2022 at 10:15 a.m.
Bail/bond hearing on June 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Wisconsin Community Service SCRAM non-compliance letter dated 6/27/22 received and filed.    ** Reviewed by Judge Lau on 6/27/22 - Clerk to set for hearing before this court ASAP.**

*Email sent to counsel to schedule for hearing to address non-compliance this week.* (am)
Preliminary hearing on July 6, 2022 at 10:15 am.
